intro: Phyllocalymma micropodioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf phyllocalymma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its pods are small and woody. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
